question: What are Jason's views on housing policy and homelessness in San Francisco?
answer: Jason believes that making more types of housing available, such as affordable housing, market rate, and transitional housing for unhoused people, would alleviate the burden of trying to get a property. He also thinks homelessness is a big problem in San Francisco and suggests making things more affordable or raising income to help people get off the streets.
source_text: so its like making more types of housing available would really alleviate that uh burden of trying to get a property but not being able to afford it so like uh affordable housing some like market rate and also like uh the what do you call it the transitional housing for uh unhoused people um policy maybe like more information like things being posted around so I can help more people especially people who are like not on track and everything I actually need help and also um I think homelessness is a really big problem to San Francisco so I think I guess trying to help people get off the streets and also make things a little more affordable or at least raise income

question: What does Jackie suggest for improving collaboration among city departments in San Francisco?
answer: Jackie suggests that more collaboration between different city departments, such as SF Public Library, SF Rec and Park, and the Department of Children, Youth, and Their Families, could yield better results in making San Francisco a more livable place for young people and families.
source_text: and um I think looking forward Id love to see more collaboration with between different city departments I know San Francisco is a really large city we have a lot of City departments and a lot of them are doing like really important work um and there are a few that work especially close with young people um I know like I mentioned like SF Public Library SF reckon Park our department of children youth and their families um yeah and they have a lot of like great programs that aim to make San Francisco a more livable place for young people and also make it a place where individuals would like to race kids yeah so I think if there was more collaboration between like these different agencies and these different departments um um they could definitely yield better results in the long term

question: What are your thoughts on the public transportation system in San Francisco?
answer: I really like Muni because it is convenient and runs frequently. However, BART should run more often, especially during peak times when buses are crowded. Overall, San Francisco does a good job with transportation, and I rely on public transit a lot.
source_text: usually I would drive but more recently Ive been like taking Bart and the muni I really do like the moon because it is really convenient and it does run really frequently so awesome sometimes yeah most of the time it does run pretty frequently but I do feel like the BART should run more because its like every like 15-20 minutes um and the bus um I feel like they probably should have a little bit more buses because especially like around where people around the time people get off school and work and everything is super crowded its like probably and everything um and but I feel like San Francisco um does do a good job of like the transportation um for me I usually rely on public transit since I live across the city from where I go to school yeah so Im I use public transit a lot

question: What are some challenges you face with the Muni system?
answer: Sometimes it is difficult to get on a bus, especially the 29, which is slow. There are issues with reliability and safety on Muni, but they are making progress with outreach and improvements.
source_text: I personally rely on like the 29 for example and I know it goes from like the baby all the way up to all the way through the sunset to like um to like Richmond where Washington is and theres a lot of kids who rely on the route and sometimes it is difficult to get on a bus but um I definitely agree with Ariana where I think Community is um or I guess to rephrases I think Muni is doing um quite a good job especially compared to like a lot of other cities um if you look at like a Muni map where you see that its we have routes throughout the city um and yeah were all like connected to the financial district downtown on the downtown area um yeah and I like especially like as someone who like serves on their youth Transit Advisory Board I see that theyre making a lot of progress too in terms of trying to do more Outreach to young people trying to alleviate some of the issues that um still exists on uni yeah but once again like I think theyre doing a pretty good job of connecting our city um yeah and I guess to speak on the other side of things I think theres still definitely are issues that um could be improved um on with Muni in terms of like reliability just getting more writers to um ride Muni and in terms of safety on Muni

question: What are your thoughts on biking in San Francisco?
answer: I think biking across the city is a great way to get to destinations, but it is expensive. There should be a push to make biking more affordable for youth, and the city should incentivize companies to make bikes cheaper.
source_text: I think if anything thing Id like to talk more about like riding bikes around the city I think with so many more like bike Lanes being added and like with JFK being closed now I think thered be more of like a push for bikes I know like theres like lift wheels and theres like bay wheels which is um a program that allows to rent out bikes for like I think minutely pay but I think there should be like a more push for the city to actually like incentivize these companies to come in and like make their bikes cheaper because I think biking across the city is a great way to get to like destinations but it is really expensive for example the other week I rode for 90 minutes and it was 30 dollars so it was pretty bad but I love biking and I think biking should be more affordable for all the youth around our city and also I guess different neighborhoods down our city

question: How does the public transit system in San Francisco compare to other American cities?
answer: Muni is pretty good compared to other American cities where public transit isn't as good. Getting to downtown from any part of SF is nice, but routes to residential neighborhoods like the Sunset or Richmond can be slow.
source_text: yeah I totally agree with you guys that uh Muni is pretty pretty good when uh in America oh and comparing it to like other American cities a lot of times the public transit isnt that good so Im very appreciative that we have the muni system but yeah uh I noticed that getting to downtown like basically any quarter at any uh part of SF getting to downtown is pretty uh nice but then like from my from my experience in my area like going to the sunset or the Richmond uh I have to catch the 29 and it takes quite a while and then also like if I want to go to like Bayview um the 54 or like the 44 isnt as reliable so like the ones that go to the residential neighborhoods arent that great but its its still possible and then downtown is very nice

question: How do budget cuts affect public schools in San Francisco?
answer: SFUSD is experiencing major budget cuts that are not helpful when trying to improve education. More funding could help address many problems in schools.
source_text: not just like the disadvantages in the Southeast but like throughout all public schools like sfusd is getting these like major budget cuts that are not very helpful when were trying to improve the education of uh young people so it would help if there could actually be more funding because there are so many problems in schools that could be improved with some more funding

question: What impact does the high cost of living have on young people's career choices?
answer: Young people are forced to choose between pursuing careers they are interested in and those that offer higher salaries due to the high cost of living.
source_text: Im applying to college soon I kind of like Im kind of balancing between like picking a major without making a lot of money later on or ones I actually enjoy doing just because I do know that like money is at the end of the day we live in a capitalist Society right so money is really important

question: Is the American Dream becoming harder to achieve in San Francisco?
answer: Yes, the American Dream is harder to achieve due to high housing prices and the difficulty for immigrants to secure high-paying jobs.
source_text: do you think the American dream is getting harder and that it may be a think back to that I think uh yes the American dream is harder now because uh that like if someones immigrating to America the chances of them getting like a high paying job is not as high as someone whos already here

question: How do you perceive the equity focus in San Francisco's city departments?
answer: I've realized how a lot of our city departments and organizations work through an equity-focused lens, uplifting marginalized communities, which isn't talked about enough on a national stage.
source_text: Ive realized how a lot of our city departments a lot of our immunizations they work through like an equity Focus lens where um it up some marginalized communities and I feel like that isnt talked about like enough like on a national stage or um or in like different states or different cities

question: What are your thoughts on the development and gentrification in San Francisco?
answer: I think with SF working to develop more, there's a danger of gentrification, so developers and planners need to be careful not to drive costs too high, which could displace people from their homes.
source_text: I could share because I think with SF like working to develop more whats dangerous about that is gentrification so Id like to see like uh during the development process uh like people keeping in mind uh gentrification and like how it could increase the cost of a neighborhood so Im not really sure how that works but uh developers and like planners got to be really careful to not drive the costs too high or else people will start getting uh moved out of their homes

question: What is your vision for the development of underdeveloped areas in San Francisco?
answer: I would love to see more development in areas of our city that historically haven't had much development, which is a major component of the new housing element. This would allow for more affordable homes and help reach our housing goals.
source_text: I think I would love to see more development on um on areas of our city which historically havent been um havent had much development I know thats a major component of this housing element like the new the newly updated one and I like I vapely remember like a statistic that was brought up in like a recent meeting with like the college interns and I know some of us sat in um on it were like 85 of like the new housing units have been built on like the east or like the central um area of our city so we have like neighborhoods where it remains a single family homes and which um havent been developed much and as a result we we are stuck in a housing crisis I think yeah and see more develop in these areas of our city would allow for more um affordable homes and yeah and I think thatll help a lot with reaching our goal of like um 80 or 88k Im housing um that were trying to reach
